list.name: Default
list.comment: Cleanup. Lots of cleanup (almost entirely in Gowing).

task.summary: Default task

Implement the FlexiGridLayoutManager which lays out components in a grid where the width and column of each grid cell is sized based on the space actually required by the components in that cell's row and column (in contrast, the GridLayout manager forces each cell's width to be the same and each cell's height to be the same). Each component is added to the underlying FlexiGridContainer with a constraint object which specifies the component's row and column within the grid as well as how the component should be justified within its cell should it's size be smaller than the space available (top, center, bottom and left, center, right).
Also implement the FlexiGridPanelModel which provides a somewhat high level interface to the FlexiGridLayoutManager. In particular, the FlexiGridPanelModel allows the easy insertion of new rows or new columns, depending on the FlexiGridPanelModel instance's orientation, either before or after specific rows or columns.
Taken together, these classes provide a relatively easy way to manage a rectangular grid of components.
The current version of the FlexiGridLayoutManager only takes each component's preferred width and height into account. This results in the width of each column being the maximum of the preferred widths of the elements in the column and the height of each column being the maximum of the preferred heights of the elements in each row. A future version with also take each component's minimum and maximum width and heights into account.
Minor changes to the Measure class to improve the formatting of its output.
Provide a way to specify if the default instance of the RandomCentral class should be a SecureRandom instance or 'merely' a Random instance. The default is to use a SecureRandom instance.

A considerably cleaned up and somewhat improved FlexiGridPanelModel.
Lots and lots of textual cleanup.

Stop using various APIs that were deprecated in Java 9 (mostly AWT APIs).
Implement the FlexiGridDivider class which provides a way to include "divider lines" in components being managed by the FlexiGridLayoutManager (strictly speaking, this is intended for use with the FlexiGridPanelModel although the actual support for it is in the layout manager part of the flexi-grid facility).
Various cleanup including a bit of reorganizing of classes and methods.

Rework the ObtuseCollections class.
Update FlexiGridPanelModel and LevenshteinDistanceUtil to work with the updated ObtuseCollections class.
A tiny bit of minor cleanup. Committing to keep in sync with Burke.

In Gowing, fix totally broken support for EntityNames and implement and cleanup support for String and EntityName arrays.
Make the Selector and Alternative classes a more complete 'model' of a combo-box.
Comment out a bunch of Logger.log{Msg,Err} calls.

Fix the handling of row selection in the tableutils classes. Selecting rows by calling CheckBoxRowWrapper.setSelected(boolean) now works in the sense that checkmarks are updated, the notifications occur, etc.
Make sure that logging messages sent to a LogsWindow are shown in the exact order that they are passed to the window.
Fix the EntityName de-serialization facility in Gowing.
Remap entity ids when packing via Gowing. This ensures that two requests to pack the same collection of objects will yield precisely the same save file (ignoring timestamps) if the objects being saved and their values have not changed. This makes it fairly easy to avoid saving a whole series of equivalent auto-save files.
Rename the LayoutTracer as the TracingLayoutManager. Minor cleanup.
Get rid of essentially all commented out lines. Cleanup some empty methods (generally, add a call to ObtuseUtil.doNothing()).
ButtonInfo to ImageButton and ButtonOwner to ImageButtonOwner. Minor cleanup.

Create a reasonably general purpose listener facility (ObtuseListenerProxy and SimpleObtuseListenerManager) which is intended to make it easy to add listener functionality to classes that are possibly best monitored via events.
Use the listener facility to add selection notifications to the wrapped combo-box and button-model classes.
Implement the WrappedLabelPanel class that is essentially a JPanel that can wrap either a JLabel or a WrappedComboBoxSelectorPanel. This makes it easier to support the degenerate case where a conceptual combo-box actually has only one value.

Implement a new GenericTag class intended to be used to create tags that uniquely identify things.
A major reworking of the Selector and Alternative classes. Each instance is now uniquely identified by a GenericTag instead of a string (makes the interface much more type-tight).
Various minor changes to push back on the many irrelevant and not so irrelevant code analysis complaints.

Move the CopierWidget class and other associated classes from the Burke project that it was implemented in to Pipestone where it is usable in various projects. Change the name of anything with a name or a string containing the word/name "Burke" to something else (usually "Obtuse" but it depends on the situation). Create an ObtuseConstants class as a centralized place for constants (out of a tiny acorn, an oak will (hopefully) take root and grow). Various cleanup.
Minor cleanup and code reorganization.

Make it easier to work with TreeSorter keys that have exactly one value by implementing a getSingleValue( K key ) method to retrieve the single value (an IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the key has zero or more than one value associated with it) and a hasSingleValue( K key ) that can be used to easily determine if a key has exactly one value associated with it.
Cleanup the event-driven style XMLParsingExample class.

Make TreeSorter class GowingPackable (still needs some testing). Add support in GowingPackableKeyValuePair for maps containing values that are Collection classes (part of making TreeSorter GowingPackable). New MessageDigest class to make it easy to include checksums in GowingPackable classes. Provide a way to control the logging level the ObtuseImageFile and ObtuseImageUtils classes. Work on cleaning up and providing a bit more functionality in the Swing selectors in FileSelectors. Annotate the parameters to most of the doit methods in YesNoPopupMessageWindow (still at least one to go). Minor cleanup here and there.

A couple of new date formats in DateUtils. Turning many of the Gowing methods that used to sometimes return null values into methods that return Optional instances. Lots and lots of minor changes elsewhere - some of which change the API slightly but (hopefully) in obvious ways. These Gowing changes impact a lot of the other Pipestone classes that support Gowing although not in ways which should be visible externally. A new MessageDigestInputStream that computes a message digest as data flows through it. Major work on the file selectors class (to the point where there's now a new FileSelectors2 class). This area still needs work as it is still harder to use than it needs to be. A FrameworkTableModel is now parameterized by any class that extends ThingInfo rather than any class that extends CheckBoxRowWrapper.RowData. Note that since RowData is already parameterized by classes that extend ThingInfo, this shouldn't break any existing usages of either class. Many methods scattered throughout Pipestone that used to sometimes return null values now return Optional instances. Also, many of these methods have getMandatory... counterparts for those cases where you KNOW that the return value will not be null. Lots and lots of cleanup all over the place.

Implement some graph theory utilities like topological sort (see GraphTheoryUtilities for a starting point). Implement the notion of a back-referenceable entity in Gowing. During packing, a back-referenceable entity that is referenced by some other entity is guaranteed to be packed before the referencing entity (note: no loops allowed). Duringuring unpacking, a back-referenceable entity's finishUnpacking method is called IMMEDIATELY after the entity is constructed and this particular call to finishUnpacking is REQUIRED to return true. This allows subsequent entities which reference the back-referenceable entity to recover and use the entity during the invocation of the subsequent entity's constructor (amongst other potential simplifications, this allows back-referenceable fields to be marked final). Note that a back-referenceable entity is allowed to reference normal not-back-referenceable entities although if it does so, the back-referenceable entity's finishUnpacking method is still REQUIRED to return true on its first call (any 'finishing' which cannot be done during that first call will need to be handled in some other way - possibly when the entity is first used after the unpacking operation has completed). Consequently, a certain amount of care is required when using a back-referenced entity. Introduce the GowingFile class which can be used to pack and unpack File instances (in reality, this class is mostly an example of how one might write a back-referenceable Gowing-aware class). Introduce reasonably complete support for packing and unpacking File instances in ways which are very analogous to how Long and Integer instances are packed and unpacked. For example, there is now a GowingFileHolder class which is very similar to the GowingLongHolder and GowingIntegerHolder classes. One point to keep in mind is that the java.util.File class can be extended (for example, one might create a MySpecialFile class which extends the java.util.File class). An instance of such a class can be packed by passing it to a GowingFileHolder instance HOWEVER when the resulting packed data is unpacked, the unpacking operation of instances of classes like this hypothetical MySpecialFile class will be unpacked into java.util.File classes. If you want to be able to pack and later unpack instances of classes like this hypothetical MySpecialFile class then you are much better off building your scheme around the new GowingFile class. Note that a future version of Gowing might prohibit the passing of instances of classes derived from the java.util.File class into GowingFileHolder instances. If you are packing and unpacking instances of classes which are derived from the java.util.File class then, if feasible, you should at least consider extending the GowingFile rather than extending the File class. Move Gowing towards having methods that might return a null value instead return an Optional instance. Still a ways to go here but progress has been made. Various cleanup. Make the packing and unpacking of TreeSorter instances more robust. Various changes to accomodate and/or take advantage of the Gowing changes described above.

Cleanup and attempts to increase the speed of Gowing (especially on the unPacking side of things). It turns out that Gowing itself is actually fairly fast. The bottleneck seems to be in the user classes which sometimes have to do a bit of a dance to get things done. I'm looking at some ideas like a better approach to handling collections. Something for the future.
Implemented TypedGowingUnPacker which is a somewhat simplified API. I'm still not happy with the amount of boilerplate code that needs to be written in userland. Another work in progress.
MonikerOwner is just a simple interface that marks classes which have a {@code String getMoniker()} method. The intent is to provide a way to clearly mark classes which can provide a possibly less than formal but still useful name for each instance. Not sure how useful it is but it's part of the Pipestone family now.
Minor change to the Logger class to make it possible to get the name of the file where a particular Logger instance is archiving what it writes. See getMirrorName() for (not much) more info.
Lots of minor cleanup in a vain attempt to reduce the noise that comes out of IntelliJ's automated code analysis.
Lots of cleanup (mostly in Gowing; other classes affected mostly be the move of Gowing exception classes into their own package).

Rework image scaling to ensure that compatible image types are used at each step of a pipeline that is reading, scaling, possibly rotating, and writing images (in other words, probably making thumbnails).
Implement a couple of utility methods which can be used to wait for images to load asynchronously or, alternatively, to ensure that images are loaded in a situation where it isn't clear if they are being loaded asynchronously.
Some cleanup (more to come - hopefully, this is just a checkpoint commit).

Basic sanity for the VirtualScrollablePanel facility. It seems to work quite well with row-oriented elements (no support at all for anything else (yet?)).
This commit contains a slightly earlier attempt to build a JTree-like facility (called FlexiGridTree) that handles more than just strings for each node. That attempt doesn't seem to be the right way to do this. I'm checking it in so that I can easily keep it around until I am sure that it is toast.
Introduction of the ObtuseArrays class for hopefully useful array-related utility methods.
Introduction of the UniqueID class which provides a Gowing-packable and fairly robust mechanism for handling unique ids. While one can achieve the same functionality by just using long or Long fields, I have found that having ids wrapped in a special class helps to find bugs where ids and non-ids get mixed up. Also, it is handly to have some utility methods that work with ids.

Cleanup of the VirtualScrollablePanel facility along with a few fairly minor bug fixes and API changes.
The biggest change is breaking up a couple .java files by moving inner classes and interfaces out into their own .java file.
Minor cleanup in ObtuseUtils.
Add a static method to the ImageIconUtils class that allows the caller to specify which class loader should be used to load ImageIcons from.
Comment out a bunch of debug output here and there.

Major cleanup in DateUtils class. Various minor cleanup elsewhere.
This is a checkpoint commit prior to changing the VirtualScrollablePanel class to allocate views one at a time on a strictly as-needed basis instead of allocating one for each model which might be visible.

Delete lots and lots of commented out lines. Throw away the old (failed) FlexiGridTree stuff. Rework the way that TwoDimensionalTreeMap.java and ThreeDimensionalTreeMap.java create empty immutable instances. Some cleanup and minor bug fixes in the VirtualScrollablePanel facility.

Implement scrolling using the mouse wheel in VirtualScrollablePanel class. Cleanup the Java generics declarations in ObtuseKeyword, ThreeDimensionalCounter and ThreeDimensionalSortedMap. Minor cleanup (mostly reformatting) elsewhere.

Move the LruCache and associated classes into Pipestone.
Rename the UniqueID class as UniqueId (this causes quite a cascade of edits to other classes).
Move the getBitMaskName and rememberBitName methods and the associated s_maskExBits array to the new Clicks class.
Various changes to ObtuseImageUtils:
- Major cleanup of the image rotation facility. Not much if anything that affects the behaviour of this facility has changed.
- Add named constants for each of the EXIF orientation values.
- Add rotateOrientationRight, rotateOrientationLeft, flipOrientationHorizontally and flipOrientationVertically methods that return the EXIF orientation value that results from the rotation or flip implied by the method name to a specified EXIF orientation value. For example, rotateOrientationLeft( ORIENTATION_LEFT ) yields ORIENTATION_ROTATED_180 since a left rotation applied to a left rotation results in a 180 rotation.
- Add a maybeRotateDimension that takes an image's dimensions, as represented by a Dimension instance, and returns a new Dimension instance with swapped width and height values if the specified orientation involves a 90 degree rotation (and possibly a flip) of the described image's dimensions. For example, maybeRotateDimension( new Dimension( 10, 20 ), orientation ) yields the original Dimension( 10, 20 ) instance for the normal (don't rotate), flip horizontally, rotate 180 and flip vertically orientations and yields a new Dimension( 20, 10 ) instance for the other orientations.
Very minor cleanup in the setZoomFactor method in the SimpleMediaItemPanel class.

Add a raft of 'add<type-name>Holder' methods to the GowingPackedEntityBundle class to facilitate more concise bundleThyself methods.
Use the new 'add<type-name>Holder' methods throughout Pipestone where appropriate (this impacts dozens of source files).
Relatively minor reorganization of the methods in ObtuseImageUtils.
Various relatively minor cleanup.

Implement ManageMainMacMenu.java which provides some rather basic Mac-specific main menu handling on a Mac.
Define the keySet() method in a TreeSorter to return a SortedSet.
Cleanup.

Restrict the LruCache to operating on the "main" thread (the thread that calls main( String[] args ) to launch a Java program) or on the event thread. This avoids having to make the LruCache thread fully type-safe (to the extent that it is necessary to do so (i.e. I have not investigated this point), an LruCache instance is (very?) likely to become corrupted if calls to said instance happen on both the "main" thread and the Swing event thread in a context when the calls could occur at the same time.
Remove some debug/trace output in the VirtualScrollablePanel class.
Comment out a static initializer in the ObtuseImageFile class that invokes
Measure.setGloballyEnabled( true );
This just seems like a bad idea. The author of the program using the VirtualScrollablePanel class should be making this decision.
In the Measure class:
- mark the getCategoryName() method as @NotNull - provide a way for the software using Measure to decide which 'bucket' an instance's data should land in after the instance has been created (see the new done(String,String) method). Neither the current specification nor the implementation of the done(String,String) method is final. Neither the current specification nor the implementation of the done(String,String) method is final.

Minor cleanup.
Commit to keep in sync with Lancot project (not likely to ever be made public).
Minor cleanup (should have been included in previous commit).
Minor cleanup.
Minor cleanup associated with the Measure facility.

Mark the preferences parameter to BasicProgramConfigInfo.init as @NotNull (this may be temporary; I'm using it to maybe find calls that could use the init variant described in the next sentence). Add a variant of BasicProgramConfigInfo.init that doesn't have a preferences parameter (I should have done this a LONG time ago). Implement a general purpose "ask the user for the name of something and then try to create a something that has that name" called CreateSomethingDialog.

Considerably reworked AutoSizingValidatedJTextField class (required to get it to work in more than just the simplest of cases).
Considerably reworked FlexiGridCache1 class (also required to get it to work in more than just the simplest of cases). This version has the notion of a filler column which is where excess whitespace is placed. This still needs more thought (not to mention that if there are filler columns then there should probably be filler rows).
Various relatively minor cleanup.
Add the WrapLayout class which is basically an extended version of the FlowLayout class that actually works.

Implement the GenericPanelManager set of classes which provides a relatively easy-to-use scrollable (eventually) JPanel of FlexiGridModelSlice(s).
Use the Optional facility across a wider range of classes.
Cleanup the FlexiGridLayoutManager class.
Implement the AwtEventToEventCategoryNameMap class to make handling of AWT events somewhat easier.
Minor and not-so-Minor cleanup here and there.

A start on making the Gowing facility thread safe.
Minor cleanup elsewhere.

Create the ObtuseVideoUtils class (hopefully, the start of something big).
Implement the AsyncStreamCaptor class which asynchronously captures the contents of an {@link InputStream}.
Implement a makeTextImageIcon method in the ImageButton class that creates an {@link ImageIcon} containing a single row of text.
Implement two more readEntireFile methods in the ObtuseUtil class that will read the contents of an arbitrarily large file (i.e. the caller does not need to provide an upper bounds on the file system). This is probably a bad idea considering that it does not provide any way to avoid an out-of-memory condition if the file is absurdly large. Already marked as deprecated.
Implement the UnixSignals class which provides various useful constants for dealing with Unix signals. Also, provides methods that make it easy to tear apart the 'exit status' of a Unix process.

Add a new date format in DateUtils (MMM_DD_HHMMSS_YYYY) to handle dates like .Mar 15, 12:15:00 2012".
Move many of the "describe this GUI thing" from LinearLayoutUtil to the new ObtuseGuiUtils utility class.
Implement a simple interface to allow the measurements produced by the Measure class to be sorted in various ways.
Implement the QuickLogger class which provides a much simpler logging facility that the existing Logger class.
Implement Page-Up and Page-Down key support in the VirtualScrollablePanel facility. It's still a bit clunky but it's a lot better than having to scroll or mouse one's way through long scrollable panels.
Plenty of minor cleanup.

Add a new date format in DateUtils (MMM_DD_HHMMSS_YYYY) to handle dates like .Mar 15, 12:15:00 2012".
Move many of the "describe this GUI thing" from LinearLayoutUtil to the new ObtuseGuiUtils utility class.
Implement a simple interface to allow the measurements produced by the Measure class to be sorted in various ways.
Implement the QuickLogger class which provides a much simpler logging facility that the existing Logger class.
Implement Page-Up and Page-Down key support in the VirtualScrollablePanel facility. It's still a bit clunky but it's a lot better than having to scroll or mouse one's way through long scrollable panels.
Plenty of minor cleanup.

Implemented a file selection dialog which is intended to be more customizable and less confusing to use than either JFileChooser or FileDialog.
Implement the DiagonalLayout manager which is intended as a test bed for future layout managers and a demonstration of a very basic layout manager.
Implement the ObtuseFlowLayoutManager which is intended as a substitute for the Java FlowLayout manager. It is hopefully more stable and predictable than FlowLayout.
Add more filesystem-related 16x16 icons (used by the new ObtuseFileSelector class).
Implement the VspSelectionUtils class. Not sure if it has an actual purpose in the long term.
Implement the BasicVirtualScrollablePanelSelectionManager class which is intended to be used with the VirtualScrollablePanel facility.
Minor cleanup all over the place.

In various places: switch to using @code rather than the html code tag in JavaDocs.
Major revamping of the AboutBox class.
In ImageIconUtils.copyToBufferedImage: eliminate the old first choice of using GraphicsConfiguration.createCompatibleImage to create a compatible new BufferedImage as this sometimes created a BufferedImage that other Java library methods could not cope with. Now, we just create a BufferedImage of type TYPE_INT_ARGB or TYPE_INT_RGB depending on whether the input Image has an alpha channel or not; extract the actual scaling of images into a new getScaledImageIcon method so that this operation can be requested directly rather than only as part of fetching an ImageIcon.
Add an ObtuseFunction5 class to allow helper methods to use five arguments.
Make ObtuseUtil.enquoteJavaStringToNakedStringBuilder public so that it can be used elsewhere.
Cleanup ObtuseCalendarDate (mostly JavaDocs).
Add a bunch of new images (used mostly if not entirely by test code) to com.obtuse.ui.resources package.
Lots of cleanup resulting from a code style analysis run.
Cleanup. Lots of cleanup.
Cleanup. Lots of cleanup.
Other than adding a few methods to ObtuseUtil, this commit is mostly minor cleanup.

MESSAGE.value: Implement scrolling using the mouse wheel in VirtualScrollablePanel class. Cleanup the Java generics declarations in ObtuseKeyword, ThreeDimensionalCounter and ThreeDimensionalSortedMap. Minor cleanup (mostly reformatting) elsewhere.

Move the getBitMaskName and rememberBitName methods and the associated s_maskExBits array to the new Clicks class.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Cleanup. Lots of cleanup (almost entirely in Gowing).
